fields.description:
I went to the Access Management section of my project (from Repository Details) and then hit the back button on my browser. When I then pressed forward on my browser I noticed that the Users and the Groups in the main column had duplicated.

If one continually press back then forward, both lists just keep getting longer and longer.

Browser: Chrome 26.0.1410.64
fields.summary: Groups & Users list in "Access Management" duplicates when using browser back and forward buttons (BB-8458)

fields.description:
h1. Description
I've tried to transfer one private repository from my account to the company account but the company admin haven´t received any message.

I've tried to transfer repository from another account to mine and didn't received any message too.

h1. More details
Repository that have been transfered:\\
https://bitbucket.org/mneves_cit/blabla

On this repository I can see these messages:\\
"This repository's ownership is pending transfer to joaog_cit. Visit the transfer repository page to view more details."

h1. Forum
I've sent this message to the bitbucket forum:\\
https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups=#!topic/bitbucket-users/Q4Dan_4FzdE

"Пригласить участников в это репо"\\
Должно быть\\
Пригласить участников в *этот* репо

Потому что репозиторий  мужского рода

Hi there,

I set up a self-hosted JIRA instance, which I linked with a bitbucket team account using the DVCS connector plugin.\\
Linking commits with JIRA issues works perfectly, but there is one small drawback: bitbucket only seems to recognize the reference to an attached JIRA when the issue key is written perfectly in uppercase letters. In case only one letter is lowercase (which happens easily in the heat of the moment), there is no link to JIRA on bitbucket. Yet the commit appears in JIRA's commits section.\\
I guess it's an easy thing for you to fix this. On the other hand, it would make bitbucket feel more consistent.

Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: Make references to linked JIRA issues case insensititve (BB-8420)

fields.description:
It would be far more efficient if a version could be created while entering an issue.

With the current setup I need to go to the repository settings, click versions, add a version, save, go back to the issue tracker, enter or edit an issue, set the version.

This interrupts the work flow when logging issues for a new version that has not been planned yet.
fields.summary: Support adding versions when filing a new issue (BB-8403)

fields.description:
Currently wiki permissions have three levels:

* None i.e. no wiki enabled
* Private i.e. only those with repository access can view and edit
* Public i.e. anyone can view and edit

It would be useful to add a new level between Private and Public which would have public view permissions but private edit permissions, what exactly such a level would be called I am not sure.  Maybe Public Viewable and rename Public to Public Editable?

This would be particularly useful when the wiki is used as the documentation hub and you want anyone to be able to view the documentation but only a limited group of people to be able to edit the wiki.

Just today I spotted a user randomly edit a wiki page and then revert their edit which was a little disconcerting because I hadn't realized just how permissive the Public setting is, but since I am using the wiki for documentation I want it to be at least public viewable.
fields.summary: Add intermediate level of wiki permissions (BB-8404)

fields.description: Currently, when I go to the main page of the repository, under recent changes, it shows committed changes by me, which is correct.  But when I go to the commits page, it show's all my commits by another user, one that used to work for us, but doesn't have permission anymore.  Likely because I inherited the computer, his .gitconfig was set to his name and email.  Though it was pushed through my BitBucket User.
fields.summary: Commit's are showing the wrong person associated

fields.description:
Here are a couple of example pages:\\
https://bitbucket.org/lambdazen/bitsy/wiki/WriteAlgorithms.md\\
https://bitbucket.org/lambdazen/bitsy/wiki/Benchmarks.md

These were working a couple of days back.

fields.summary: Cannot invite attendees of my training

fields.description:
In the Overview screen, the Recent Activity shows a different username from the Commits screen.

It looks like the Overview/Recent Activity screen is picking up the name of the Bitbucket user who committed the file, whereas the Commits screen is picking up the Git alias as per the local .gitconfig.

It would be nice for the 2 to be consistent (from our perspective, showing the Bitbucket username would make more sense, as it would allow the Bitbucket username aliases to kick in.)
fields.summary: Mismatching names in Overview and Commits

fields.description:
Hi,

Would it be possible to add pagination on dashboard overview page (https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview)?

When doing reviews on my team repo activity, I can't see any activity beyond the first page, which poses a big problem.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Show more/all newsfeed items, not just the most recent (BB-8374)

fields.description:
Sorry if this is the wrong place to post this, but I couldn't find it [here|http://pythonhosted.org/Markdown/index.html#differences] in the differences between python markdown and John Gruber's Markdown. It is described in John's document [here|http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/syntax#autoescape].

This is shown on one of my repositories [overview page|https://bitbucket.org/davidcorne/wordpress-to-markdown] but on an offline markdown editor it appears fine.
fields.summary: Markdown does not display < when < was used (BB-8359)

fields.description: When viewing a changeset (pull request, or a commit, so such) the UI has a fixed width of 980px. This is really quite ridiculous on a wide screen with lots of whitespace on either side and the scollbar at the very bottom, making for a very poor user experience. When doing code reviews I usually open firebug and adjust the width to 95% and hey presto, nice wide layout and things scale nicely. Can we make that a permanent change and do away with the fixed width? (setting some sort of minimal width of course).
fields.summary: Allow viewing source/diffs without width restrictions (BB-8405)

fields.description:
I seem to have two email addresses attached to my profile which are identical apart from the case of some of the characters.  They are both listed on the Email Addresses page.  One of the emails is marked as the 'primary' address and the other has an option to 'resend confirmation'.

My account constantly says the email address is unconfirmed in the header bar.

If I click on the 'resent confirmation' link the page changes to show both email addresses as 'primary'.  However, as soon as I navigate away from the page the error reappears in the header bar and the email addresses page returns to the previous state.

If I try to delete the second address it says I can't delete the primary address.
fields.summary: Identical emails (with mixed case) get confused in the profile page

fields.description:
Chosing a repository name written with exactly 4 chinese characters causes the repository URL to be of the form:

https://user@bitbucket.org/user/----.git

where each chinese character has been replaced by a dash. Trying to create a different repository with a *different* name, but the *same number of characters* (e.g. 4 in this case), results in the following message on https://bitbucket.org/repo/create:

"You already have a repository with this name."

The name of the first repository is displayed correctly in the web interface. Adding some form of repository ID the the URL would solve this problem.
fields.summary: Chosing chinese character names for repositories resuls in repository name clash

fields.description:
put in a report on this already and would like info about it I believe it said issue 7209 I think.\\
Its about using safe in firefox where page starts out blue then goes to red on crdit card info.
I was checking out on some sites with safe 112 and it starts out secure blue border then goes to red border when I get to crdeit card info.  padlock has exclamation point  but says https in url

On commit https://bitbucket.org/stochastic/impactstory-pdf-parser/commits/9ca3e011ef5a7ec3316b420f01ec64fba81f3393, the committer shows up as physmed, when it's marrrcandre.

This is Pretty Bad.

Maybe it's an oversight, but I'm always having to cancel my pull request because I forget to change the default to DEV not master.  Is there any way to change that?

we rarely merge into master because that's our prod.  can we choose our default fSOURCE for pull requests as something other than master?

thanks
fields.summary: Choose your default destination branch on pull request

fields.description:
Can you please have an option for rich HTML for emails sent via Email Diff service?

This would be great because Email Diff sends code and code part is not in a monospace font and thus not legible.
fields.summary: Email diff service with Rich HTML option (BB-8344)

fields.description:
When a user creates an issue, they upload a .docx file to document and supply screenshots of what I need to duplicate the issue. They are able to see this file right after they upload it.

Then they or I come back after a day or so, it get a 404 error on every file that was uploaded when trying to retrieve the file.

Unless I'm missing something here, the only way to re-assign an issue is to edit the ticket and reassign it.

Why can't the ticket options (assignee, kind, priority) be included with the comment form?

We bounce issues back and forth all the time, which means that the comment form is completely useless.
Its really hard to do code reviews with the kind of diff's you guys show. Can we please make it better? Sending you a screenshot. Not sure if its a bug in css or browser compatibility issue.

Hi,\\
Would be great if you will have contributions graph and stats like GitHub.\\
It's a great graph to check your team mates activity.

Attached GitHub screenshot.

Thanks!
affter selected an icon, it didn't display the upload pic.
fields.summary: Repository avatar upload form preview doesn't work correctly (BB-8372)

fields.description:
I have a newly setup Confluence+JIRA+Bitbucket setup.

I click on the members tab of 'nfcdata-ondemand', and I see:

"Add your teammates\\
Your OnDemand instance can automatically invite new developers to Bitbucket. When creating a new OnDemand user, simply select the Bitbucket groups you wish to invite the user to join. Once added to Bitbucket, you can manage your teammates directly from Bitbucket."

I click the "Manage Members" button, and I get:

"Access to the webpage was denied\\
You are not authorized to access the webpage at https://bitbucket.org/account/user/nfcdata-ondemand/groups/. You may need to sign in.\\
HTTP Error 403 (Forbidden): The server refused to fulfill the request."

I am the Global Admin and creator, so I'm not sure why I am getting a 403.

this is debug key:1682d4f30bc54c39872ed354a4739a64$53260971926ecd9201fcb9992f072c10

i can't see my source codes of my project\\
project url:\\
https://bitbucket.org/kemalkanok/kkwf

All the headers on this Wiki page is malformed. It appear that the parser thinks a sequence of numbers within the id of the header should be a link to a source commit.

https://bitbucket.org/thomthom/london-underground-travelnews/wiki/Release_Notes

You can get raw contents of a wiki page via API with {{GET repositories/{accountname}/{repo_slug}/wiki/{page}}}. It does not tell which of the supported markups (Markdown, reStructuredText, Textile, Creole) is used on that page. I guess you can get it by cloning wiki and looking by file extensions but that is not very practical. :)

This has been previously asked in [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/wiki%2BResources%3FfocusedCommentId%3D317950500#comment-317950500] in January but I did not see any reference to it here in issue tracker.
fields.summary: Show markup used in wiki page via API

fields.description:
Hello -

When using our custom dns to visit the site, i've found the following failure scenarios:\\
Start Page: http://code.rizon.net/account/signin/

Attempt to login via any OpenID method:

* http://code.rizon.net/social/google/redirect/
* http://code.rizon.net/social/facebook/redirect/
* http://code.rizon.net/social/twitter/redirect/
* http://code.rizon.net/social/github/redirect/

Will results in 404 page.

Hi,\\
I Do Not Seem To Be Getting The Admin Gear Icon:

Would be nice to be able to stich many repos together into a user's statically hosted site.

e.g.

* I have my main site myuser.bitbucket.org
* I give a lot of presentations, using things like reveal.js and impress.js
* I manage each presentation in a separate repo, mainly so I can track upstream changes in the base presentation library.
* I want these presentations to appear in my main site, myuser.bitbucket.org/presentaitons/presentation1/ & myuser.bitbucket.org/presentaitons/presentation2/
* presentation1 & presentation2, are git submodules that point to their respective repositories.

This would be a pretty awesome feature. And could be extended to many different purposes, like product docs which can track the base repos.

I have a proxy which allows me to directly connect to bitbucket.org rather than through CNAME redirection.

I suggest that there should be a "waive rights to complain" mode where you just honour the HOST header wrt the associated repo.

The main motivation for this is to not require a subdomain, e.g. mydomain.com points to a proxy(notably because the proxy and the DNS server need to be co-located) rather than some spurious extra www or suchlike. So mydomain.com would internally map to myuser.bitbucket.org
fields.summary: custom domains only support CNAMEs not direct proxying (BB-8377)

fields.description:
Your email notification controls are too coarse-grained. I assume that if I disable email notifications, I will get neither fork notifications (annoying, useless spam) nor notifications of things that have actual value, such as pull requests or new bugs.

Please either kill fork notifications entirely, or allow people to be more selective in what they receive.

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Copy this feed link: https://bitbucket.org/sirgazil/kanary/rss .
# Validate on: http://validator.w3.org/feed/ .

*What should happen:*

The feed should validate.

*What happens instead:*

The feed does not validate, and shows the following errors.

{code}
Sorry

This feed does not validate.

    line 39, column 20: Invalid email address: sirgazil (15 occurrences) [help]

            <author>sirgazil</author>
                            ^

    line 543, column 2: Missing channel element: description [help]

          </channel>
          ^

In addition, interoperability with the widest range of feed readers could be improved by implementing the following recommendation.

    line 8, column 88: Self reference doesn't match document location [help]

        ... " xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" />
                                                     ^
{code}

*Additional information*

This issue impedes the use of recent activity feeds in services like WordPress with [the RSS widget|http://en.support.wordpress.com/widgets/rss-widget/].
fields.summary: Recent Activity RSS feed is not valid (BB-8439)

fields.description: when i created a new wiki page and found that there is only home page visible , so i have to write a index page manually to link to the new page.

I have only collaborated with, and am only following, a single Bitbucket user. Yet when I want to invite collaborators and give them permissions on my repositories, typing the first 5 letters of his name/username doesn't get him anywhere near the first suggestion.

Can you make user suggestions affected by who I'm following, who is following me, and/or who I've collaborated with in the past?

fields.description:
The column containing the commit numbers and authors is slightly misaligned with the main code, so after about 100 to 150 lines it's totally out of sync. This is probably only a CSS issue - maybe if both code and the metadata column are given the same line-height in px, the issue should go away?

I'm using FF20.0.1 on linux, just in case the bug is not easily reproducible

git init.

Otherwise one gets:

git remote add origin https://mojojojo@bitbucket.org/mojojojo/mojo.git\\

See [BB-8318|https://bitbucket.atlassian.net/browse/BB-8318]

fields.description:
Hi Atlassians,

I'm generally very happy with all the services I've tried from Atlassian. Our team is using Jira and Confluence OnDemand happily for over a year now.

We are currently in the process of evaluating changing over to Bitbucket from GitHub as your pricing policies make a lot more sense.

I signed up for a free 5-user account. Then I invited some members from my team in order to get the 3 extra spots you so prominently advertise in the right hand column of the landing page. They signed up too, and I can see that (see attached screenshot).

Except, I can't push anymore. I got an email telling me I have to upgrade. What on earth? Needless to say my feelings are a little mixed with the Bitbucket evaluation right now.

Thanks in advance.

Kind regards,\\
Bojan
The comment is not added to a file line in commit. JSON request fails with HTTP 500
fields.summary: Unable to add comment to the file line

fields.description:
If a Git repository hosted on Bitbucket contains files/paths that use international characters such as "ä" and "ö", the corresponding file names are corrupted (e.g. "ö" gets replaced with "├╢") in a ZIP package download of the repository that Bitbucket provides.

I've created a public repository in Bitbucket that should show you the problem:

https://bitbucket.org/fo/test
fields.summary: Git zip files with UTF-8 characters don't extract properly on Windows (BB-8425)

fields.description:
При заполнении поля "Псевдоним" в профиле, нельзя вводить цифры и символы.\\
Но если ввести символ, то появляется сообщение предупреждающее об этом такого типа "Поле Псевдоним: может содержать символы и цифры"\\
скорее всего тут "...не может содержать..."

I logged in as investigator3 and selected "View All Cases".  It showed all the cases (even ones not assigned to me).  I then went into each case and was able to see all the documents, notes and other relevant information.

I created a new investigator (investigator3).  I then changed one of the cases already initiated by removing an investigator and assigned the case to investigator3.  Then logged in as investigator3 and selected "My Cases" from the top.  It said you have no cases assigned.

Hello,

I'm a native portuguese speaker and I'm testing the "Portuguese Language" beta version of the website. I found a translation error:

In any "repository page", the tab named "Source" is translated to "Origem" (which would be a very literal and weird translation). A better translation would be "Código Fonte" (normally it sounds a little strange to say only "Fonte" without "Código", which means "code").

Thanks n_n
fields.summary: In "BR Portuguese language", wrong translation to "source" (the source code) (BB-8300)

fields.description: The overview would be much more useful if included the branch a commit (or group of commits) is on.
fields.summary: Newsfeed/overview should include the branch a commit was on (BB-8302)

fields.description:
I'm requesting the ability to mark inline comments as outdated manually, as we have workflows where comments are made to one section of code which actually require a fix in another section of code.  We'd prefer to manually mark the comment as addressed/outdated even if the LOC in question wasn't modified by any commit.

The current workaround is to just reply to the message with a "fixed" or something to that effect, which we'd do anyway, but after a long review with many of these, the inline code gets polluted with many stale comments.  Deleting is not desirable as we'd like an audit trail of the comments made.

Thanks
fields.summary: Manually mark comments as "outdated" in pull request (BB-8303)

fields.description:
Hello support, how are you?

I am a fresh new French user and I have seen a display issue showing a miss-closed tag on the url:

https://bitbucket.org/account/user/bastianb/plans-and-billing/

On this page in the first rectangle for Plan under 'Changer de dépot' (en: change repo?) we can see '">Gérer la facturation' (en: Manage Billing ?)

It does not allow us to click on the button 'Gérer la facturation'; I have then sort it in major problems - I don't know if it is working for English viewers, that's your part of investigation :)

I also have provided a screenshot to show you :)

Do not hesitate to contact me back if you need more details.

Thank you !
fields.summary: Html tags shown up on page

fields.description:
I'd like to specify the column width of a wiki table, for which I use the textile syntax.

http://txstyle.org/doc/15/tables states, that you can have something like this:

|a|{color:red}. styled|cell|

Following that pattern, other sources (http://forums.obsidianportal.com/comments.php?DiscussionID=1363) suggest to use that feature to specify the column width, like:

|{width:25%}. Cell1 |{width:25%}. Cell2 |{width:25%}. Cell3 |{width:25%}. Cell4 |\\
| Cell 5 | Cell 6 | Cell 7 | Cell 8 |

But it seems that the curly-brackets-notation is completely not working in the bitbucket textile implementation.
fields.summary: HTML attributes should work for textile formatted wiki pages (BB-8307)

I check this sandor.toth@umbicord.com one, but there is no ssh key.

So it should be a bug.

Could you please check it?

Kind regards,\\
Sandor

I use the evolve extension to have a proper history in my projects (eg https://bitbucket.org/logilab/pylint/), whose development may be handled on bitbucket.

So there are many cases where I want to accept a PR but don't want the merge proposed by bitbucket (slight modification done before integration, want only one changeset for the feature instead of a whole branch merged, etc).

I currently  have to reject the PR telling it has actually been integrated, which is imo really not satisfying, at least from the submitter POV.

Until evolve workflow is properly supported, it would be worth adding a no-merge-accept feature where I could tell that the PR has been accepted and integrated in changeset 1a2b3c4d.

* While importing an SVN repository

fields.description: A colleague pushed some commits to a shared repo using a unknown email. The commits are marked as submitted from a unknown source and can be liked to a user by manually adding a alias for the email and this works fine, but when the colleague added the email to his bitbucket account the references did not get updated and stopped working after we removed the alias in the project.

fields.description:
Please see here for discussion:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/160170/bitbucket-urls-when-browsing-repos-always-contain-hash

tl;dr

It would be nice to provide an option to create URLs with branch name instead of commit hash when browsing the repo. For the most part, when I link to file or folder in the repo, I want the link to point to the latest commit in the branch, and not the specific one.

GitHub does it nicely by generating URLs like this:\\
https://github.com/symfony/symfony-standard/tree/_master_/src
fields.summary: Option to replace the commit hash in URL with branch name when browsing source tree (BB-8297)

fields.description: Hi, could we request Dart as an official language designated to a repo? Cheers!

fatal: Not a git repository (or any of the parent directories): .git
{code}

this is a bug?

(sorry my bad English).

Regards

Just stumbled across this: All servers except bitbucket04 seem to be running Git 1.7.10.3

В профиле пользователя, в закладке "Наблюдать" (например https://bitbucket.org/ekkertan/profile/following) ошибки синтаксиса и пунктуации:

"Вы не за кем не наблюдаете\\
Возможно вы предпочтете иметь свою рубашку ближе к телу."

нужно:

"Вы *ни* за кем не наблюдаете.\\
Возможно**,** вы предпочитаете иметь свою рубашку ближе к телу."

Hello!

I install second system on my computer (Manjaro Linux) and added ssh-keys to bitbucket.\\
I can clone or push repository using git.\\
But if I try to make deploy with capistrano, I got this error:

executing "if [ -d /home/kamskool/www/kamskool-dev/shared/cached-copy ]; then cd /home/kamskool/www/kamskool-dev/shared/cached-copy && git fetch -q origin && git fetch --tags -q origin && git reset -q --hard 7472ac04e4a987bab9a61714f843b742cae8ac3b && git clean -q -d -x -f; else git clone -q git@bitbucket.org:faron/kamskool.git /home/kamskool/www/kamskool-dev/shared/cached-copy && cd /home/kamskool/www/kamskool-dev/shared/cached-copy && git checkout -q -b deploy 7472ac04e4a987bab9a61714f843b742cae8ac3b; fi"\\
servers: ["198.61.214.113"]

[198.61.214.113] executing command

[198.61.214.113 :: out] conq: repository access denied.

[198.61.214.113 :: out] fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly

command finished in 3453ms\\
failed: "rvm_path=$HOME/.rvm/ $HOME/.rvm/bin/rvm-shell '1.9.3-p286@kamskool-dev' -c 'if [ -d /home/kamskool/www/kamskool-dev/shared/cached-copy ]; then cd /home/kamskool/www/kamskool-dev/shared/cached-copy && git fetch -q origin && git fetch --tags -q origin && git reset -q --hard 7472ac04e4a987bab9a61714f843b742cae8ac3b && git clean -q -d -x -f; else git clone -q git@bitbucket.org:faron/kamskool.git /home/kamskool/www/kamskool-dev/shared/cached-copy && cd /home/kamskool/www/kamskool-dev/shared/cached-copy && git checkout -q -b deploy 7472ac04e4a987bab9a61714f843b742cae8ac3b; fi'" on 198.61.214.113

see:\\
conq: repository access denied.\\
The remote end hung up unexpectedly

what is the problem?\\
if I try to make deploy in my first system (Arch linux), everything is ok with deployment.

would be _fantastic_ to be able to customize the headers on the issues page - and this should be fairly easy.  For example - i don't use 'version' but do use 'component' field.  would be nice to remove the 'created' and 'version' field and add the 'component' field!!!

this shouldn't be too tough to implement either in the settings page.  it seems like the only settings available are whether or not the issue tracker exists and if it is private or public.

Thanks!
fields.summary: customize (able) column headers on issues page (BB-8239)

fields.description:
here is the offending notification. Note that torchenko@gmail.com is no longer on the project (not in Members) although it used to be.

--

From: azielinski [pullrequests-reply%40bitbucket.org]\\
Subject: Re: [adhome/no.9] Advert submission - tooltips and minor fixes ([PR#13|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/pull-requests/13])\\
Date: 20 апреля 2013, 05:52:41 GMT+03:00\\
To: torchenko@gmail.com

--- you can reply above this line ---

New comment on pull request:

https://bitbucket.org/adhome/no.9/pull-request/13/advert-submission-tooltips-and-minor-fixes#comment-210077

azielinski said:

this method is not called on adverts with bookings disabled, - even if it was then after this change we would get fatal error instead of exception ($advert->getCancelPolicyHandler()->doStuf());

--

Unwatch this pull request to stop receiving email updates:\\
https://bitbucket.org/adhome/no.9/pull-request/13/unwatch/pilya/245646bd3e61a834ce9f7ecb8186c2b3454e282f/
fields.summary: User is no longer on the members list but still receiving PR notifications

Hi it would great if I could create one issue tracker for multiple repositories (aka modules) - kind of project issue tracker for code modules (where each module has separate repo).

* I just need to be able to track issues in different repos so they are automatically updated when some push change etc (redmine does this and I think assembla as well) - but I can imagine this could be a lot of work to implement?
fields.summary: One wiki/issue traking for multiple repositories (BB-8236)
